thread.title: Here's what to expect at Yeti's big new store in Austin

title: Here's what to expect at Yeti's big new store in Austin
text:

Yeti is opening an 8,000-square-foot store at 220 South Congress Avenue in Austin on Thursday, Feb. 23. Photo: Photo Provided By Yeti. Image 6 of 32 25 facts about YETI coolers
Whether they are holding the most precious of cargo on a fishing trip -- your beer -- or keeping your iced drink cold, YETI's coolers and drinkware have managed to become a part of the pop-culture landscape in Texas and beyond.
Click through to learn more about this rugged Austin-based brand...
less 25 facts about YETI coolers
Whether they are holding the most precious of cargo on a fishing trip -- your beer -- or keeping your iced drink cold, YETI's coolers and drinkware have managed to become a part of ... more Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 7 of 32 Humble beginnings The company was co-founded by Austin-area brothers Roy Seiders and Ryan Seiders in 2006. Humble beginnings The company was co-founded by Austin-area brothers Roy Seiders and Ryan Seiders in 2006. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 8 of 32 Indestructible The brothers said that the coolers that they were using just couldn’t handle their own outdoor adventures so they decided to make some of their own. Indestructible The brothers said that the coolers that they were using just couldn’t handle their own outdoor adventures so they decided to make some of their own. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 9 of 32 A new market is found In 2008, YETI began selling its products in Bass Pro Shops and Cabela's, tapping into the outdoor enthusiast market.
A new market is found In 2008, YETI began selling its products in Bass Pro Shops and Cabela's, tapping into the outdoor enthusiast market. Photo: Bob Owen, STAFF Image 10 of 32 That means they are sturdy YETI’s coolers are rotationally-molded, which is the same process used to make rugged whitewater kayaks. That means they are sturdy YETI’s coolers are rotationally-molded, which is the same process used to make rugged whitewater kayaks. Image 11 of 32 A small crew As of April 2016, YETI had only 312 employees. The company moves into a new headquarters in Austin in 2017. A small crew As of April 2016, YETI had only 312 employees. The company moves into a new headquarters in Austin in 2017. Photo: Cody Duty, Staff Image 12 of 32 Crowdsourcing YETI will take submissions for product ideas from customers but they ask that if you think your idea is novel that you file a patent before submitting it to the company.
Crowdsourcing YETI will take submissions for product ideas from customers but they ask that if you think your idea is novel that you file a patent before submitting it to the company. Photo: Cody Duty, Houston Chronicle Image 13 of 32 Brand ambassadors The brand has numerous official ambassadors from the worlds of BBQ, hunting, fishing and adventuring, like Aaron Franklin, Tuffy Stone, Flip Pallot, the Malloy brothers and Eva Shockey. Brand ambassadors The brand has numerous official ambassadors from the worlds of BBQ, hunting, fishing and adventuring, like Aaron Franklin, Tuffy Stone, Flip Pallot, the Malloy brothers and Eva Shockey. Photo: Catchlight Photography Image 14 of 32 Ice science The brand has an entire webpage dedicated to getting the best out of your cooler. As it turns out you shouldn’t leave your cooler out in the direct sunlight if you don’t want that ice to melt so fast. less Ice science The brand has an entire webpage dedicated to getting the best out of your cooler. As it turns out you shouldn’t leave your cooler out in the direct sunlight if you don’t want that ice to melt ... more Photo: YETI Image 15 of 32 Small ice, baby When it comes to ice, YETI says that smaller, cubed pieces of ice are more suitable for use with the coolers, but they suggest that dry ice is the best kind of ice to use. It’s science. Small ice, baby When it comes to ice, YETI says that smaller, cubed pieces of ice are more suitable for use with the coolers, but they suggest that dry ice is the best kind of ice to use. It’s science. Photo: Getty Images Image 16 of 32 Party prep On the company website they detail how many 12-ounce cans can fit in each of its coolers, just in case you are the one having to buy the beer for the river trip.
Party prep On the company website they detail how many 12-ounce cans can fit in each of its coolers, just in case you are the one having to buy the beer for the river trip. Photo: Picasa Image 17 of 32 All over the world
Yeti coolers are designed in Austin, but the production takes place across the globe, including Iowa, Wisconsin, the Philippines and China.
All over the world
Yeti coolers are designed in Austin, but the production takes place across the globe, including Iowa, Wisconsin, the Philippines and China. Photo: Shaun Mendiola Image 18 of 32 IPO-ready According to YETI’s 2016 filing for an initial public offering, it had a net sales growth from $89.9 million in 2013 to $468.9 million in 2015. The company’s net income increased from $7.3 million in 2013 to $74.2 million in 2015. less IPO-ready According to YETI’s 2016 filing for an initial public offering, it had a net sales growth from $89.9 million in 2013 to $468.9 million in 2015. The company’s net income increased from $7.3 million ... more Photo: NA Image 19 of 32 Lots of likes The brand’s Facebook likes grew from 182,000 in December 2013 to more than 419,000 as of early April 2016.
Lots of likes The brand’s Facebook likes grew from 182,000 in December 2013 to more than 419,000 as of early April 2016. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 20 of 32 Double-tap Instagram followers grew from 20,000 in December 2013 to more than 349,000 in March 2016. Double-tap Instagram followers grew from 20,000 in December 2013 to more than 349,000 in March 2016. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 21 of 32 It paid off How did that happen? From 2013 through 2015, YETI invested $42 million in marketing alone. It paid off How did that happen? From 2013 through 2015, YETI invested $42 million in marketing alone. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 22 of 32 Bear-proof, God forbid YETI says that its coolers are bear-proof and they created a video featuring a real, live grizzly bear trying to pry one open. The Interagency Grizzly Bear Committee assisted YETI in the research study, subjecting one of the coolers to the paws and awesome strength of two grizzlies. less Bear-proof, God forbid YETI says that its coolers are bear-proof and they created a video featuring a real, live grizzly bear trying to pry one open. The Interagency Grizzly Bear Committee assisted YETI in the ... more Photo: Deby Dixon, For The Washington Post Image 23 of 32 Think smallish YETI products are sold by more than 6,000 independent retailers, eschewing mass merchandisers, club stores and discounters. Forget even Amazon.
Think smallish YETI products are sold by more than 6,000 independent retailers, eschewing mass merchandisers, club stores and discounters. Forget even Amazon. Photo: Gary Fountain, Gary Fountain/For The Chronicle Image 24 of 32 REI helped just a tad Adding their products to the shelves at REI also increased profits, reaching out beyond the Gulf Coast audience it enjoyed previously. REI helped just a tad Adding their products to the shelves at REI also increased profits, reaching out beyond the Gulf Coast audience it enjoyed previously. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 25 of 32 YETIs and ammo Academy accounts for 15 percent of all sales. YETIs and ammo Academy accounts for 15 percent of all sales. Photo: Marie D. De Jesus, Staff Image 26 of 32 Country livin' YETI stated in its IPO prospectus that its products benefited from being in the music video and lyrics of "Buy Me a Boat" by Chris Janson and in the music video for "Save It for a Rainy Day" by Kenny Chesney. These were both unsolicited endorsements, YETI notes.
less Country livin' YETI stated in its IPO prospectus that its products benefited from being in the music video and lyrics of "Buy Me a Boat" by Chris Janson and in the music video for "Save It for a Rainy Day" by ... more Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 27 of 32 Awesome job YETI has a group of so-called “super users” that test prototypes and provide feedback. How does one get that cherry gig? Awesome job YETI has a group of so-called “super users” that test prototypes and provide feedback. How does one get that cherry gig? Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 28 of 32 April Fools! Each year the YETI company comes up with a new fake April Fool's Day prank on social media, first introducing the YETI Casket in 2014. April Fools! Each year the YETI company comes up with a new fake April Fool's Day prank on social media, first introducing the YETI Casket in 2014. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 29 of 32 Life saver Earlier in 2016 a couple credited their YETI cooler with saving their lives after they had boat trouble near Galveston. Life saver Earlier in 2016 a couple credited their YETI cooler with saving their lives after they had boat trouble near Galveston. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 30 of 32 'Merica YETI has a 460,000-square-foot facility in Dallas operated by Ozburn-Hessey Logistics that handles inventory and shipping. 'Merica YETI has a 460,000-square-foot facility in Dallas operated by Ozburn-Hessey Logistics that handles inventory and shipping. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 31 of 32 YETI ever after The company holds 26 issued patents and 313 pending patent applications so it seems that for years to come we'll be seeing new YETI products. YETI suits of body armor can't be too far behind. YETI ever after The company holds 26 issued patents and 313 pending patent applications so it seems that for years to come we'll be seeing new YETI products. YETI suits of body armor can't be too far behind. Photo: Instagram: YETI Coolers Image 32 of 32 Here's what to expect at Yeti's big new store in Austin 1 / 32 Back to Gallery Austin-based cooler company Yeti is opening a flagship retail store Thursday in its hometown.
The 8,000-square-foot space at 220 South Congress Ave. will have a stage for live music, an indoor/outdoor bar, a product customization station and an array of Yeti's "historical" artifacts. It is the company's first stand-alone store.
MORE: Rivals Yeti, RTIC put cold legal situation behind them
"The Yeti Flagship store is a convergence of the lifestyle we stand for, the products we offer and the community we live in," Yeti CEO Matt Reintjes said in the news release. "It's a gathering spot for locals and out-of-towners to enjoy a cold beer, listen to music, watch a film or learn from a pro."
Yeti's 30-ounce tumbler costs $39.99 on its website. Its hard-side coolers range from $249.99 for its Roadie, which holds 14 cans, to $1,299.99 for its Tundra 350, which is its largest cooler with 19,000 cubic inches of capacity that can hold multiple elk or several offshore fish.
